introduction: Iâ€™m an engineering undergraduate student keen on growing my skillset to provide a helping hand to projects that benefit our day to day lives
bio_main: Hey ðŸ‘‹    My name is Alex Lassooij, I'm an Electrical Engineering student at UBC. Since being introduced to programming as a freshman, Iâ€™ve expanded my knowledge and skillset through university courses, bootcamps, hackathons and various personal projects. Throughout my short yet continuing journey, Iâ€™ve been driven my passion of using software to provide creative, efficient solutions that may benefit the lives of many others.
bio_experience: As of today, Iâ€™ve been involved with multiple student engineering teams and am interning as a Software Engineer at medical device company Kardium Inc. Some of the technologies Iâ€™ve worked with include :

experience.title: Kardium Inc.
experience.description: Kardium Inc. is a medical device company based in Burnaby, BC that has developed the Globe Pulsed Field System, an advanced technology to treat atrial fibrillation.
experience.contribution: Since starting at Kardium in May, my work has focused on improving a tool that enables Analytics and Testing teams to analyze medical procedure logs. This has involved writing thorough specifications, requirements and tests to implement updates to components, as well as consulting users of the tool to handle feedback and additional user stories.

experience.title: UBC Launch Pad
experience.description: UBC Launch Pad is a student-run software engineering design team. Students work together in groups consisting of developers, designers and leads to build applications that provide novel solutions to common challenges we may face.
experience.contribution: I helped my team develop a mobile group task management app. It features progress tracking, task quotas and a points system. The app was built with Flutter and hosted on Firebase and uses Firestore as a database.

experience.title: Building Blocks
experience.description: Building Blocks Peer Mentoring is a student initiative that aims towards improving student life on campus. Using an algorithm, freshmen will be matched with an upper-year mentor. Through their mentors, incoming students will have the social, academic and professional support they need to thrive on campus.
experience.contribution: Starting with no experience with web development, I quickly became familiar with frontend fundamentals. As a result, I was able to create multiple reponsive web pages for our MERN app. Once I learned some backend development basics, I helped implement chat functions using socket.io

experience.title: UBC Solar
experience.description: UBC Solar is an engineering design team that builds solar-powered electric cars. Every component from the chassis, suspension, PCBs and firmware are designed and created by the team. Pre-covid, UBC Solar's cars would compete in North America-wide solar car endurance races
experience.contribution: On the software team, I mainly wrote firmware to implement the handling and synchronization of messages to the car's main control board. This was facilated with the help of a FreeRTOS OS kernel and embedded C.

projects.title: dealbreaker
projects.description: An iOS app built by myself using React Native. The app allows users to search for items listed on Amazon in-app, and add a given item to a so-called â€˜Watch listâ€™. Using background processing, the app would check the prices of items on the users watch list at regular time intervals. If it finds that the price of an item is lower than at the time it was added to the list, the user will be notified with a push notification.

projects.title: CrossyRoad
projects.description: A remake of the popular mobile game CrossyRoad purely written in Java. The game allows the player to navigate around the board with keyboard input and animates moving cars smoothly. This project required me to make many considerations concerning the design of the game and how each game component would interact with one another. As a result, I have a firm understanding of OOP

projects.title: SociaLion
projects.description: Ideation of a social-skill training mobile app presented at BizHacks, winning 3rd place and an $800 prize. The app's goal is to help people break through their social anxiety through guided interactions. Following a self assessment to gauge their behaviour in social settings, users participate in guided interactions with virtual or real users in a VR environment

projects.title: Amazoon
projects.description: An Amazon clone. This clone automatically simulates a warehouse in real-time. For example, when an order is placed through our webpage, robots will physically move around the warehouse, gather the order's items and place them into a truck, all without any human interaction. Synchronization is achieved through mutual exclusion and a database that holds live information about orders and items. Completed as a term project for a Systems Software Engineering course. Written in C# with an ASP.NET MVC webpage, mongoDB database and WinForms as a graphical display for the warehouse

projects.title: Feed Me
projects.description: A Slack bot for the Slack workspace. I created this bot to help people choose their next meal when work or other responsibilities leave little time to ponder about food. Users can choose to eat either eat nearby, or have a recipe suggested based on what's in their pantry. Created with Python and Slack Block Kit

projects.title: This Website
projects.description: My portfolio, a simple web page designed to showcase some of my experiences, projects and a bit about myself. It is created with React and minimal other frameworks (i.e. no Bootstrap) to maximize my understanding of HTML and SCSS used in React components created by myself

projects.title: RISC Machine
projects.description: As part of an Introduction to Microcomputers course, I was required to design my own Reduced Instruction Set Computer. Using Verilog, I created all necessary components such as the datapath, ALU, etc. I wrote exhaustive unit tests and debugged the machine by analyzing key signals produced by several components and using the De1-SoC FPGA board (pictured right). As a result, the machine was able to carry out various ARM instructions and ranked as the 11th most efficient out of 100+ machines.

projects.title: ECE Projects Year 3
projects.description: For my 3rd year Electrical Design Studio, I worked in a team of three to design and simulate a 3 DOF robot arm. This involved the use many different tools such as Matlab, Simulink, SimulationX, Solidworks, Multisim and Altium. Work was divided intro three main areas : Software, Hardware and Mechanical Design. I was responsible for the Software portion, including the design of a closed loop system with PID tuning, path planning, and code for PID control, handling ISRs and driving pins.

projects.title: ECE Projects Year 2
projects.description: For my 2nd year Electrical Design Studio, I completed two projects. The first (pictured left) is a metal detector. It is capable of detecting ferrous and non-ferrous metals. Metallic objects placed inside an induction coil are detected as they change the oscillation frequency of the device's A-stable oscillator. The second project (pictured right) is a water level detector. It measures the water level in a cup using the fact that the cup's capacitance varies with different water levels
